How different is the climate impact of different foods?

When it comes to GHG emissions not all foods are created equal. Depending on how they are produced their climate impact can vary a lot.

As a general rule it holds that products that involve animals emit more than those that are made directly from plants. To read more about why, read these two articles

LINK INEFFICIENCY AND METHANE FROM COWS

The numbers in the first graph are just estimates and means. Here is an overview of the internal variation within product groups:

Further Reading

A more detailed explanation of how emissions can vary within a group of products and why meat still has the most impact on the climate: Less meat is nearly always better than sustainable meat, to reduce your carbon footprint (Our World in Data)
